nodes.bodyText: This exception is shown to the user. No need to log the same message using LinkageCheckerRule's logger.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+def buildLog = new File(basedir, "build.log").text
+
+assert buildLog.contains("Failed to collect dependency: "
+        +"[xerces:xerces-impl:jar:2.6.2 was not resolved. "
+        +"Dependency path: ant:ant:jar:1.6.2 (compile) > xerces:xerces-impl:jar:2.6.2 (compile?)")

nodes.bodyText: Is there a change that needs to be made to stop using that logger?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+def buildLog = new File(basedir, "build.log").text
+
+assert buildLog.contains("Failed to collect dependency: "

+        +"Dependency path: ant:ant:jar:1.6.2 (compile) > xerces:xerces-impl:jar:2.6.2 (compile?)")

nodes.bodyText: No need. The logger is currently not used for this.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+def buildLog = new File(basedir, "build.log").text
+
+assert buildLog.contains("Failed to collect dependency: "
+        +"[xerces:xerces-impl:jar:2.6.2 was not resolved. "
+        +"Dependency path: ant:ant:jar:1.6.2 (compile) > xerces:xerces-impl:jar:2.6.2 (compile?)")

nodes.bodyText: I was wrong. There's unnecessary warning message.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+def buildLog = new File(basedir, "build.log").text
+
+assert buildLog.contains("Failed to collect dependency: "
+        +"[xerces:xerces-impl:jar:2.6.2 was not resolved. "
+        +"Dependency path: ant:ant:jar:1.6.2 (compile) > xerces:xerces-impl:jar:2.6.2 (compile?)")

nodes.bodyText:
The warning message (example) comes from enforcer rule plugin. It's not something we can fix at LinkageCheckerRule class.
Therefore, no need to change logging.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+def buildLog = new File(basedir, "build.log").text

+assert buildLog.contains("Failed to collect dependency: "
